page.title: 03FARMING IN COWICK.
page.content: {Bull Farm}is a fruit farm selling produce such as apples and strawberries.The present 9 acre site was part of a 200-300 acre farm stretching across the hill towards Ide and across the valley towards the dual carriageway.The original farm was purchased by the Water Authority as a site for a new office complex,but they failed to get planning permission so they sold off the land divided into various smaller lots.The farmhouse is built of stone, not cob,so it is thought to be about 200 years old.The present owner,Mr.Ward,hopes to buy back some of the original land and buildings.Customers are allowed to pick their own fruit,and we found it took about 30minutes to pick a tray of strawberries.
